content.title: 70 lat temu ukazał się „Mały Książę” | dzieje.pl - Historia Polski
Lis, a może Lisica? О przekładzie osobowych nazw własnych w „Małym Księciu” Antoine’a de Saint-Exupéry’ego | Półrocznik Językoznawczy Tertium

results:
Based on the search results, I found comprehensive information about the Polish translations of "The Little Prince" ("Mały Książę") by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry, specifically regarding the work of Jan Szwykowski and Marta Malicka, and the publication history in Poland.

Here are the key findings about the Polish translations and publication history:

## First Polish Translation - Marta Malicka (1947)

Polish was the first language in the world to which "The Little Prince" was translated (not counting English, which was published a few days before the French edition). The book was published by Spółdzielnia Wydawnicza "Płomienie" in Marta Malicka's translation already two years after the end of the war (Warsaw, 1947). In Polish, "The Little Prince" appeared for the first time in 1947 published by Spółdzielnia Wydawnicza "Płomienie" in Marta Malicka's translation.

## Jan Szwykowski's Translation Dominance

Although Jan Szwykowski's translation is the most popular, Polish readers first received "The Little Prince" in Marta Malicka's translation. The version in Jan Szwykowski's translation has the most editions - over 50 (as of 2024). Probably the most popular is Jan Szwykowski's translation. It is precisely his versions of quotes from "The Little Prince" that Poles most often repeat.

## Publishing History of Szwykowski's Translation

The search results show an extensive publishing history of Jan Szwykowski's translation through PAX Instytut Wydawniczy:

First edition in 1958, followed by multiple editions: II (1967), III (1968), IV (1969), VI (1970), VII (1971), VIII (1972), IX (1976), X (1981), and XI (1985), with print runs ranging from 20,000 to 80,000 copies.

## Multiple Polish Translators

Other translators of "The Little Prince" included Marta Cywińska, Halina Kozioł, Barbara Przybyłowska, Piotr Drzymała, Wiera and Zbigniew Bieńkowscy. The basic research corpus consists of the original French version of the novel and fifteen selected Polish translations published between 1947-2021.

## Historical Context

Interestingly, before the second Polish translation appeared, on August 12, 1956, in issue 13 of "Kierunki" magazine, the full text of "The Little Prince" was published. Of course, in Marta Malicka's translation.

The search results demonstrate that "The Little Prince" has a rich publication history in Poland, with Marta Malicka being the pioneering translator in 1947, while Jan Szwykowski's translation became the most popular and widely published version with over 50 editions.
